linkjvm.high.motors

Class Motor

  • java.lang.Object
    • linkjvm.high.motors.Motor

  • public class Motor
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a motor object with a given port.
    Since:
    2.0.0
    Version:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Markus Klein

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Motor(int port)
      Creates a new Motor object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void backward()
      Turns the motor speed to full backward.
      void blockMotorDone()
      Sets the current thread to idle until the motor is done with movement.
      void clearPositionCount()
      Resets the position counter of this motor object to 0
      void forward()
      Turns the motor speed to full forward.
      void freeze()
      Prevents the current motor movement.
      int getPort()
      Returns the port of this motor object.
      boolean isMotorDone()
      Returns if the motor is done with movement.

      Moves the motor at velocity with the specified ticks per seconds.
      void moveToPosition(int speed, int targetPos)
      Moves the motor to the specified position at the specified.
      void moveToRelativePosition(int speed, int posDelta)
      Moves the motor from its current position to current position + pos.
      void off()
      Turns the motor off.
      void setPidGains(short p, short i, short d, short pd, short id, short dd)
      Adjusts the weights of the PID control.
      void setPort(int port)
      Sets the port of this motor object.
      void turn(int percent)
      Turn motor on the specified percentage.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Motor

        public Motor(int port)
      throws InvalidPortException
        Creates a new Motor object.
        Parameters:
        port - port of the Link, where the motor is connected to
        Throws:
        InvalidPortException - If the specified port is invalid

    • Method Detail

      • clearPositionCount

        public void clearPositionCount()
        Resets the position counter of this motor object to 0

      • moveAtVelocity

        public void moveAtVelocity(int velocity)
        Moves the motor at velocity with the specified ticks per seconds.
        Parameters:
        velocity - velocity in ticks per second (range from -1000 to 1000)

      • moveToPosition

        public void moveToPosition(int speed,
                  int targetPos)
        Moves the motor to the specified position at the specified. If motorPosition > specifiedPosition, the motor does not move.
        Parameters:
        speed - motor speed (range from 0 to 1000)
        targetPos - motor position until the motor stops

      • moveToRelativePosition

        public void moveToRelativePosition(int speed,
                          int posDelta)
        Moves the motor from its current position to current position + pos.
        Parameters:
        speed - speed in ticks (range from -1000 to 1000)
        posDelta - difference of the current and the final position

      • setPidGains

        public void setPidGains(short p,
               short i,
               short d,
               short pd,
               short id,
               short dd)
        Adjusts the weights of the PID control. If the motor is jerky, the p and d values should be reduced. If a motor lags far behind they should be increased.
        Parameters:
        p - numerator for p coefficient
        i - numerator for i coefficient
        d - numerator for d coefficient
        pd - p respective denominator
        id - i respective denominator
        dd - d respective denominator

      • freeze

        public void freeze()
        Prevents the current motor movement.

      • isMotorDone

        public boolean isMotorDone()
        Returns if the motor is done with movement.
        Returns:
        true if motor is done with movement, false otherwise

      • blockMotorDone

        public void blockMotorDone()
        Sets the current thread to idle until the motor is done with movement.

      • forward

        public void forward()
        Turns the motor speed to full forward.

      • backward

        public void backward()
        Turns the motor speed to full backward.

      • turn

        public void turn(int percent)
        Turn motor on the specified percentage.
        Parameters:
        percent - percentage with which the motor turns

      • off

        public void off()
        Turns the motor off.

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns the port of this motor object.
        Returns:
        port of the link, where the motor is connected to

      • setPort

        public void setPort(int port)
             throws InvalidPortException
        Sets the port of this motor object.
        Parameters:
        port - port of the Link, where the motor is connected to
        Throws:
        InvalidPortException - If the specified port is invalid
